text:
Aww yeah! I'm so excited for today's lesson, 
because we're learning with one of my favorite

singers Sia. So we're going to look at a 
couple interviews with her and then we'll learn

with a couple of her popular songs. And if you 
just want one or the other then you can skip to

whatever part you want using the chapters feature 
down below. Now you might notice that her accent

is a little bit special, that's because Sia 
comes from Australia, but she's been living

in the United States for so long that it is 
really soft, so you might not even notice that.

And finally if you're a really 
big fan of Sia like I am,

then you're not going to want to miss out on the 
extra lesson that we have over on our Instagram,

with another one of her popular songs.
So now let's jump in!

Alright, so now we will continue with another 
interview with Sia, where you actually get to

see her face, but quickly before we do I want to 
let you know that if you are new here every single

week we make fun lessons, just like this one, to 
help you understand fast speaking natives, just

like Sia, without getting lost, without missing 
the jokes and without subtitles. Like Emil,

who says that thanks to our videos and our Fluent 
with Friends Course, he has greatly improved

his English vocabulary, pronunciation and even 
grammar. And you will too, it's really simple:

hit that Subscribe button and the Bell down below, 
so you don't miss a single one of our new lessons.
All right, so Sia is actually trying her hand at

film. She recently directed a movie 
called Music, which is coming out in 2021.

By the way, if you find it confusing when 
natives speak like this, then I highly

recommend you try our 3-Part Masterclass. Now 
in addition to tips for how to learn vocabulary

and understand the jokes, we will teach you how 
to understand natives when we speak really fast

and connect our speech, just like 
you've seen here. It's absolutely FREE

and you can learn more and sign up by clicking 
up here or down the description below.
